title: What Does “TOTM” Mean? Plus, When & How to Use It

steps.title: The acronym “TOTM” stands for “Time of the month.”
steps.content: The acronym “TOTM” stands for “Time of the month.” Used in text messages and over social media, “TOTM” refers to the time when a person is menstruating, or on their period. [1] X Research source It can be used in casual exchanges with close friends, family members, and romantic partners. “FYI, it’s that TOTM, so I don’t want to stay out too late.” “Ugh, I keep craving fried foods because it’s the TOTM for me.” “I’m not in the mood to argue. I’m too tired, and it’s that TOTM.”

steps.title: Use “TOTM” to explain your PMS symptoms.
steps.content: Use “TOTM” to explain your PMS symptoms. Did you accidentally shout at a loved one or overreact to a comment that they made? Send a quick “TOTM” text message to apologize for your behavior and explain why you might be more sensitive than usual. Some common PMS symptoms include: mood swings, irritability, insomnia, headache, fatigue, and cramping. [2] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source “What’s wrong?” “TOTM.” “Sorry for snapping at you earlier. It’s that TOTM.” “I understand why I kept crying last week. It’s the TOTM for me.”

steps.title: Text “TOTM” to politely cancel plans.
steps.content: Text “TOTM” to politely cancel plans . Have upcoming plans that you really regret agreeing to? Mention that it’s that “TOTM” to get out of them at the last minute. Most people won’t question your excuse, so it’s one of the best ways to cancel on someone without hurting their feelings—just make sure you don’t pull this one too often or get caught in the lie! Them: “You’re still meeting us at the beach, right?” You: “I’m so sorry, but I don’t think I’ll be able to make it. It’s that TOTM.”

steps.title: “Top of the morning”
steps.content: “Top of the morning” This Irish expression is used to greet someone in the morning, and it’s the English equivalent of saying “Have a good day.” [3] X Research source Since it’s a casual and cheerful way to say hello, use it anytime you want to make someone smile or lift their spirits. “You: “Ello, gov’nor🫡” Them: “🤣🤣🤣 Top of the morning to you!”

steps.title: “Tailored Operational Training Meal”
steps.content: “Tailored Operational Training Meal” In the military, a TOTM is a lightweight packaged meal that’s meant to be a lower-calorie “sack lunch” version of the Meal, Ready to Eat (MRE). It usually contains a MRE entree, wet-pack fruit, a beverage base, flameless heater, dining kit, and other assorted components, and it’s used for inactive duty training. [4] X Research source

steps.title: DND
steps.content: DND This popular abbreviation stands for “Do Not Disturb,” and it’s used to tell someone that you don’t wish to be contacted for the time being. [5] X Research source Text “DND” to your loved ones if you’re about to take a nap, enter a meeting, or just need some alone time. Or, send it to close colleagues if you’re planning to go on vacation. “My exam is in 10 minutes, DND🤫” “DND, I’m about to walk in for my interview.” “I’m going to be on vacation until next Friday, so DND.”

steps.title: SMH
steps.content: SMH Lots of people physically shake their heads when they’re disappointed, and “SMH” is a simple way of putting that physical motion into text form. It stands for “Shaking my head,” so throw it in the chat anytime you want to express disapproval or annoyance about something. [6] X Research source “My tutor arrived 45 minutes late SMH.” “SMH they just ran out of espresso at Starbucks🙄” “My coworker just went off on me SMH. Trying to keep my cool😤”

steps.title: GTG
steps.content: GTG This is a short and simple way of saying “Got to go,” and it’s used to politely end a text conversation . [7] X Research source If you have upcoming plans you need to attend, drop “GTG” to let the other person know you have to leave. “GTG, class is starting!” “GTG, it’s my turn at the DMV.” “I have to pick up my mom from the airport. GTG✈️”

steps.title: FR
steps.content: FR Drop this abbreviation when you want to check if someone’s being silly or serious over text. It stands for “For real,” and it’s another way of saying “Seriously?” or “Really?” [8] X Research source Them: “Guess who just made an A+ on her physics final?” You: “No way, FR?! Congratulations🎉”

steps.title: MB
steps.content: MB This short abbreviation means “My bad,” and it’s a casual way to apologize without making a big deal out of the situation. It could be for a minor mistake like accidently but-dialing someone, showing up late to pick them up, or forgetting to return something you borrowed. [9] X Research source Them: “Just wanted to check that you’re still picking me up?” You: “Oh crap, I thought it was Friday. MB! Heading over ASAP!!”
